Found this while looking at Smarter Every Day for somewhere to ask a question, so here goes.

I just finish watching a TV show that said that the heat in the core of the Earth was:
A. Residual from the formation of the planet and
B. Generated by the decay of radio active elements.

But I have to ask:

The Earth has a MASSIVE magnetic field. Since molten iron (the core) is not magnetic, is it possible that this spinning magnetic field would be generating electrical current? Or the moving (spinning) electric field generating a massive magnetic field? Either way, wouldn't all that current in a poor conductor (not copper or graphene) create a lot of resistance heat?

Just asking.

P.S.: Today dumb has taken the connotation of being foolish, but the original intent of the word 'dumb' was it can't speak. The only dumb question is the one that's not asked.

There is a Destin, FL.

Thought you should know.

How come?  How come when I am doing exercises in the swimming pool, and it is time to hold arms straight out and make little circles with me hands,  I always make counterclockwise ones with one hand and clockwise ones with my other hand. I mean this with ZERO disrespect.

For me to get behind this I need you to unequivocally answer a question you've been avoiding pretty well all these years. Do you or don't you accept evolution science? On the one hand, avoiding this could indicate that you don't; on the other the avoidance could be to speak to the religious in a non-threatening way to advocate scientific thought. But in order for me to accept you as the opposite voice in the experiment you describe above, I need to know that you ARE that opposite voice. That you accept the understanding gained through science. If you deny any of the process you undermine the whole process.

For clarity. I know you are a man of faith. You can believe both in a god or gods and still accept the full body of science.
